Job description

Shaw and Partners is one of Australia’s preeminent investment and wealth management firms. We have a proven track record of offering high-quality professional advice to retail, corporate and institutional clients across Australia.

  • Liaising with clients and conferring with co-workers to answer inquiries or resolve account problems
  • Checking the validity of documents and facilitate settlement of financial product transactions
  • Performing clerical tasks, such as answering phones or distributing mail
  • Ensuring all client files are up to date and fulfilment of regulatory and compliance requirements
  • Preparing client letters, reports, bulk portfolio runs, spreadsheets, research or any other mail-outs
  • Preparing documents for investment advisers prior to meetings and assisting with any follow-up items.
  • CRM database management
  • Management of trade allocation and bookings
  • Planning and execution of client events/client entertainment
  • Developing marketing materials to build a portfolio of new clients.

\xa0

The successful applicant should hold a relevant tertiary qualification or be working towards obtaining such a qualification. The successful applicant is likely to have experience in a finance related field and/or a direct client service environment.

\xa0

Candidates with previous Dealers Assistant, Adviser support (from either a stockbroking or financial planning background) or investment operations experience will be highly regarded. In addition, top tier candidates will also possess:

  • RG146 compliant
  • A mature, professional attitude, with an ability to self-manage
  • The confidence to adapt to a fast paced and demanding environment

Reporting to the Operations Manager, your responsibilities will include:

  • Exposure and competent use of BCA, Rescode and AUTOCAD;
  • The ability to communicate professionally, prioritise and meet deadlines; and

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 134 views

Job description

Grow a Better Tomorrow with Nufarm.

\xa0

We know that growing is about more than just crops and cultivation. It’s about sunshine and rain, early mornings and hard work. It can be frustratingly unpredictable but also wonderfully uplifting. More than anything, it’s about people. Nufarm is the dependable partner behind thousands of agricultural success stories. Every day, growers around the world turn to our products and our people to help with the challenges of fighting disease, weeds and pests, and to increase crop yields.

\xa0

How can you grow with Nufarm?

\xa0

We’re on a digital transformation journey here at Nufarm. It’s because of this we’ve created a new opportunity for a strategic thinking Business Analyst to join our Regional IT team. In this role, you’ll be a key enabler in the delivery of benefits from the IT Portfolio to the ANZ business. You’ll spend your days helping guide key stakeholders through the IT portfolio stages as a trusted advisor.

\xa0

We’re committed to building an inclusive environment and are open to flexible or part time working arrangements for this role. This is a hands-on and autonomous role that offers the opportunity for true ownership of outcomes. Bring your know-how and creativity to make Nufarm stand out in the crowd.

\xa0

What will you be doing?

\xa0

  • Reviewing and assessing opportunities to provide digital solutions for Nufarm’s business model
  • Working with various stakeholders to elicit high level requirements and capture business needs
  • Clearly articulating and documenting business requirements to develop robust business cases
  • Contributing to risk reviews of various solutions
  • Driving the prioritisation process of competing business demands
  • Participating in design reviews and walk throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions, especially relating to benefits realisation
  • Supporting the enterprise architecture teams and identifying solution interdependencies
  • Engaging with a focus on usability and user interface needs when designing systems
  • Engaging with business sponsors and super user community to enable and enhance benefits realisation
  • Proactively resolving customer satisfaction issues

\xa0

What do you bring?

\xa0

You’re a degree qualified and commercially savvy Business Analyst who has a breadth of IT experience in process centric, global organisations. You bring broad domain experience in areas such as IT Portfolio Management, Enterprise Architecture, Benefits Realisation and Program/Project Management. You have strong business case development and exposure to benefits tracking and reporting.

\xa0

Analytical and results driven, you’re a natural communicator who easily guides and influences diverse groups of stakeholders.

\xa0

If you want to be a part of a thriving, supportive environment and are inspired by the prospect of being a part of something bigger, we’d love to hear from you.

\xa0

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. All employment decisions are decided based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We are committed to building an inclusive environment for all Nufarm employees.\xa0

837566220:
[

Account Manager - Travel

Company Name News Corp Australia Company Location Southbank, VIC

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 123 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who we are

We are news. We are sport. We are lifestyle. We are travel. We are News Corp Australia.

The nation's most influential media organisation, News Corp Australia reaches an unduplicated audience of 16 million Australians every month. As well as our famous news and sports brands, we lead the way in fashion, food, travel, health, real estate and parenting. We have the largest online news audience in the country, with a bigger digital footprint than Facebook.



What's the role?

We're searching for a driven Account Manager to manage a highly valuable and profitable Travel portfolio. You'll be required to generate new business opportunities and sell creative advertising solutions across web, mobile, tablet and print. Central to this role is generation of strong sales revenue through delivery of innovative and seamless advertising campaigns and hands-on account management to our well respected travel clients. You will develop and present proposals, maintain travel competitor awareness and market movements, and effectively manage relationships with your direct clients and agencies to increase sales revenue.

In this highly sought after role, you'll be required to establish new relationships through your well-honed business development skills whilst also continuing to provide integrated media solutions to your existing travel clients. Across this ever-changing media landscape, you'll be required to drive multi-platform digital and print offerings and in turn provide strategic advertising insights into what drives brands.



Who you are

You are someone who loves all things travel, the person who steers the conversation to travel at dinner parties. You are well-travelled, both domestically and internationally and are genuinely excited about the category.

Ideally, you'll have experience as an Account Manager within Digital, Agency or Publisher environments. You'll have proven business development success and a solid track record of increasing sales within your existing client base. You'll be digitally savvy and if you have previous experience selling digital solutions across various platforms this will be looked upon favourably! You'll be known for your articulate communication and negotiation skills, target-oriented approach and energetic nature.

You truly thrive working in a fast-paced and high performance culture; therefore you need to be a self-starter who gets a kick out of hunting new business and achieving your sales targets. You're a true collaborator who has the ability to build genuine and valuable working relationships. You are confident when prospecting and presenting to businesses which is underpinned by your creative solution-selling and customer-centric approach. It's also essential that you hold a valid license and have your own vehicle.



What's next?

This is a full-time permanent position based at our Southbank office. We're offering a competitive salary package and sales incentive program with uncapped accelerator. In addition, there are many other awards on offer for high performance; interstate and overseas experiences and access to a multitude of Melbourne's key social events. There's also an on-site gym, coffee on tap, and plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby to keep your work/life balance healthy.

To apply or find out more about careers with us, see newscorpaustralia.com/careers.

Our company

Toshiba (Australia) Pty Limited is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toshiba Corporation, a global technology leader servicing the Information Systems, Consumer Electronics, Electronic Imaging and Social Infrastructure markets.

\xa0

Toshiba Australia’s Electronic Imaging Division (EID) is growing. We are expanding beyond our traditional Multi-Function Devices (MFDs) to provide our customers with innovative solutions that improve efficiency and effectiveness in their business operations.

\xa0

Our opportunity

We have a great opportunity for an experienced Service Manager to join our Melbourne team, reporting to our National Service Business Manager. The primary purpose of this position is to manage and maintain an efficient after sales support team to meet our customer’s and company expectations, objectives and KPI’s.

\xa0

The successful applicant will be comfortable leading change to ensure our processes and methodologies remain current, in line with industry, and global standards in supporting customers. They will be confident with their peers to suggest the way forward to ensure Toshiba remains relevant to our customers.

\xa0

Key responsibilities include:

  • Continuously optimise what we do for our customers
  • Achieve financial results
  • Ensure Technician’s productivity targets are met
  • Provide the highest level of support to our customers, and internal stakeholders
  • Make sure our staff are ready and trained to offer onsite support, and get issues resolved first time
  • Manage spare parts stock and usage to achieve results

\xa0

Our requirements

\xa0

Our culture

\xa0

Our benefits

To attract the best, we offer a competitive salary package which includes additional superannuation benefits, product discounts, salary sacrifice, discounted healthcare, Citibank discounts plus many more.

\xa0

If you are looking to achieve a better quality of life, make Toshiba your next move and apply today. Applications close on the Friday 21st September 2018

\xa0

Committed to People. Committed to the Future. Toshiba.

SAP Functional Consultant - Melbourne

Company Name IBM Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

Managing SAP Functional Consultant

Melbourne

IBM has a 30 year history of collaboration and co-innovation with SAP. IBM formed the first SAP System Integration Practice and currently there are more than 30000 SAP consultants globally in IBM.
The SAP Practice in A/NZ began in 1995, and has a long history of successful delivery. The Practice is currently in growth mode, with a number of recent new projects.
Focus and Differentiation
The current focus is on S/4HANA transitions. No organisation has undertaken more of these than IBM. We bring our business expertise and technical innovation together to deliver step change value to our clients. This manifests in a HANA Impact Assessment tool, 12 industry templates to accelerate and de-risk projects, the use of a “Bluefield Approach” to deliver transformation whilst maintaining the best of the original system, and IBM cloud to provide end to end accountability.
The Need for this Role
Building demand in the market and an increase in IBM’s share of it, creates a need for more SAP consultants. In particular, we need consultants with natural consulting skills, energy, and an ability to embrace new methods and techniques. Clients are seeking faster times to value, best practice standardisation, and a corresponding emphasis on business integration rather than bespoke development.

Required Attributes
  • A proven ability to integrate an SAP functional area into a business, or a part of a business
  • Experience in defining and successfully delivering client workshops to achieve agreement and mutual understanding
  • Superior problem solving skills with a client success focus
  • An ability to work semi-autonomously to deadlines
  • Broad SAP understanding and/or depth in a specific functional area
  • An ability to travel
  • Proven team player with demonstrable flexibility
Desired Attributes
  • S/4HANA transition experience
  • At least one end to end SAP transition or implementation
  • Experience and skills in one or more of – Data Migration; Interface Development; Testing; Defect Management; Training
Successful candidates can expect to work as a part of a dynamic team delivering excellence to clients.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

SAP Functional Consultant - Melbourne

Preferred Tech And Prof Experience

SAP Functional Consultant - Melbourne

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Whether it’s support with getting to work, catching a local footy game or taking the scenic route, Hireup gives people the tools needed to live the most flexible, seamless and supported life possible. With over 30,000 registered users in communities all across Australia, Hireup is a national network of local supports. As a purpose-led organisation, we promote a culture defined by its humanity, curiosity, and creativity, and allow this to infuse our services, product and people.


Hireup’s on the ground partnership and workforce engagement teams are the engines of Hireup’s growth, with State Managers responsible for running these high performing teams. The State Manager is responsible for managing and growing the state team, a significant sized budget, multiple targets, and scaling Hireup’s national impact.


To pull off this massive undertaking, you need to be a natural leader, a ruthless prioritiser and non-stop builder. We are looking for seasoned general managers and executives with a track record of managing budgets, scaling business and programs and developing top talent. You will be the glue that connects regional teams to HQ and vice versa. To do that you’ll need to build strong relationships with your remote teams and your cross-functional partners at HQ. Expect 10 days of travel per month to stay in touch with your remote teams and HQ.


State Managers are based in the state's capital (Melbourne) and report directly to the Head of Community (HQ).


The big picture


  • Join Australia’s fastest growing, for-purpose tech scale-up (we recently topped Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 List)
  • Build and implement a strategic vision and translate it into tangible operational plans at lightning speed
  • Build and lead a high performing team, developing and retaining top talent\xa0


Priorities - the work


  • Ensuring the successful implementation of regional rollout plans with your team
  • Managing and assuring regional growth targets are achieved
  • P&L responsibility for the state
  • Managing local team members
  • Synthesizing market feedback for product, marketing, operations, and other HQ teams
  • Executing large-scale initiatives
  • Contributing to cross-market strategic planning
  • Obsessing over data to identify opportunities and capture value
  • Build the local teams as per the demands of the regions


Skills - the person\xa0


  • 7+ years of senior operational management experience including significant time in a fast-growth, startup environment would be highly desirable
  • Experience in a health or community sector, especially disability sector is a must
  • Experience in other health care or aged care sectors will also be highly considered \xa0
  • Prior P&L responsibility
  • Experience managing large (10+) teams
  • The ideal candidate must be growth-oriented and excited by achieving and exceeding growth targets
  • Driven, ambitious and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing environment
  • Thrives on having clear KPI’s and working towards regional targets
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent presentation skills, confident in facilitating small and large groups
  • Mobile within the community (e.g. have own transport)
  • Effective time management skills and an ability to organise and prioritise your own schedule
  • An inspirational leader who doesn't need in-person interaction to influence and affect change
  • A deep connection to Hireup mission and core values


What you’ll get from us


  • An attractive salary, $100K - $120KK + super (depending on experience)
  • Supported to work from your community
  • The chance to be part of a meaningful challenge and to see the impact of your work
  • An open culture that thrives on new initiatives and ideas
  • Working with a motivated founding team that is leading change in its industry and driven by a passion for positive social impact
  • Flexible work hours


The position is full-time and the salary will be dependent on experience. For more information about the role and how it fits within Hireup\xa0or to apply, contact our People & Culture Partner, Sarah via people@hireup.com.au.\xa0

837545867:
[

Flight Data Coordinator

Company Name Airservices Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 341 views

Job description

The Flight Data Coordinator team plays a critical role in the information that is delivered to various domestic computer systems and International Air Navigation Service Providers (ANSPs). In liaison with key operational stakeholders, the team is responsible for managing live operational data as well as the utilisation of various ATS systems in real time within the National Airways System (NAS).


The primary purpose of the Flight Data Coordinator role is to process operational Air Traffic information into and out of the Melbourne Air Traffic Services Centre (ATSC) that is not processed automatically by the Eurocat Air Traffic Management system.


The role is responsible for managing the accuracy and integrity of live operational information within the NAS and other International Airways Systems. This role has a direct impact on aviation safety and administration both internally and externally.


The Flight Data Coordinator operates in a rotational 24/7 shift working environment and reports operationally to the duty Operations Room Supervisor and administratively to a nominated Line Manager.


As a Flight Fata Coordinator, you are required to create, administer and deliver operational information to affected stakeholders in the live, operational, real time environment by,

  • Analysing operational requirements across various systems, to provide safe and expedient solutions for the management of air traffic;
  • Interrogation, verification and processing of messages from internal and external sources in order to provide or maintain the accuracy and integrity of the NAS;
  • The communication of aircraft movement information to national and international civil and military air traffic services facilities;
  • Interpreting specifications and customising the operation of various Air Traffic Management Systems ensuring optimum solutions to meet operational requirements
